unnormalised: AI startup, DataVerse AI, based outta Bangalore, just raised a cool $5M in seed funding. Their main product, 'BharatGPT', is supposed to be a rival to those international AI models, ya know? Aiming to understand Indian languages & context better. Pretty cool, huh?
normalised: A-I startup, DataVerse A-I, based out of Bengaluru, just raised a cool dollar five million in seed funding. Their main product, 'Bharat G-P-T', is supposed to be a rival to those international A-I models, you know? Aiming to understand Indian languages and context better. Pretty cool, huh?

unnormalised: The funding round was led by Nexus Ventures and a few angel investors. DataVerse AI plans to use the cash to beef up its team of engineers & researchers, and, of course, to improve BharatGPT's accuracy. They're claiming BharatGPT can handle Hinglish no probs, and even understand local slang from different states.
normalised: The funding round was led by Nexus Ventures and a few angel investors. DataVerse A-I plans to use the cash to beef up its team of engineers and researchers, and, of course, to improve Bharat G-P-T's accuracy. They're claiming Bharat G-P-T can handle Hinglish no problems, and even understand local slang from different states.

unnormalised: According to their CEO, Mr. Rajesh Kumar, BharatGPT is currently training on 1 TB of Indian data. They're planning a public launch by Q4 2024. Let's see if it actually manages to compete with ChatGPT or Gemini. Keeping my fingers crossed for this desi AI, bhai!
normalised: According to their C-E-O, Mister Rajesh Kumar, Bharat G-P-T is currently training on one terabyte of Indian data. They're planning a public launch by Q four two thousand and twenty four. Let's see if it actually manages to compete with Chat G-P-T or Gemini. Keeping my fingers crossed for this desi A-I, bhai!
